recipe: Whole grain bagel lightly toasted, topped with cream cheese and smoked salmon, garnished with capers and red onion slices.
A mix of roasted vegetables such as bell peppers, zucchini, and cherry tomatoes, served with a balsamic vinegar and olive oil dressing.
Finely chopped green beans mixed with grated coconut, turmeric, and chili, quickly stir-fried.  Serve with a portion of cauliflower rice or a whole grain like quinoa for a complete meal.
Minced fish mixed with potatoes, onions, and spices, encased in a whole wheat pastry and baked.

Whole wheat pasta tossed with a variety of lightly sautéed spring vegetables (zucchini, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes) and a splash of olive oil and garlic.
Layers of thinly sliced zucchini replacing traditional pasta, filled with ricotta cheese, spinach, and a homemade tomato sauce, topped with a sprinkle of mozzarella cheese.
A comforting soup made with wild rice, chunks of lean chicken breast, celery, onions, and low-fat cream or milk substitute to reduce calories.

Roasted cashews simmered in a rich and creamy sauce made with coconut milk, curry leaves, and a touch of cinnamon.

Cubed pumpkin stewed with rich coconut milk and seasoned with curry leaves and mustard seeds. This stew is comforting and provides a good amount of fiber.

recipe: Tender pieces of chicken cooked with drumstick leaves, known for their health benefits, in a curry made with onions, tomatoes, garlic, and traditional Sri Lankan spices.

A mix of vegetables such as bell peppers, snow peas, carrots, and mushrooms stir-fried in a minimal amount of oil with garlic and a dash of low-sodium soy sauce. This dish is high in fiber and vitamins.

Use a minimal amount of sugar for fermentation or substitute it with a suitable sugar alternative.  Serve with a side of diabetic-friendly sambol or curry, such as tomato onion sambol or a light dhal curry, to add flavor without excessive carbohydrates.

Opt for a mix of rice flour and fiber-rich flours like oat or barley flour to improve the nutritional profile. Ensure the dough consistency remains suitable for pressing through the string hopper maker. Pair with high-protein and low-fat curries such as chicken or vegetable curry made with lots of vegetables and lean meats. Incorporate plenty of spices to enhance flavor without adding calories.

Use shirataki noodles or spaghetti squash instead of traditional pasta to drastically reduce the carb content. Prepare the sauce with egg, Parmesan cheese, and turkey bacon to keep it lower in fat. Garnish with parsley and more grated Parmesan. Serve with a side of steamed or roasted vegetables for added nutrients.
Prawns, turmeric, chili powder, fenugreek seeds, green chilies, and thin coconut milk. Accompany with a small serving of brown rice or cauliflower rice for a lower carb option.

recipe: Red lentils, onions, green chilies, curry leaves, turmeric, and unsweetened coconut milk.  Ideal with a piece of whole grain roti or a side of mixed vegetables.

Boiled jackfruit seeds, turmeric, homemade curry powder, a bit of tamarind paste, and light coconut milk. Accompany with a small portion of brown rice or cauliflower rice for a low-carb option.

Romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions, feta cheese, olives, grilled chicken breast, olive oil, and lemon juice. Perfect as a light yet satisfying meal.

Whole wheat flour for the roti dough, mixed vegetables (carrots, cabbage, green beans), onions, turmeric, curry powder, and a small amount of coconut oil for cooking. Serve hot with a side of cucumber raita.
Cubed pumpkin, roasted coconut paste, turmeric, fenugreek, mustard seeds, curry leaves, and a small amount of coconut oil. Accompany with a small serving of brown rice or millet for added fiber.
